arm_group.description: 3D knee kinematic assessment under local anesthesia

brief_summary.textblock:
Problem : Precise and personalized 3D knee kinematic assessment during physical and daily
      life activities is a challenge; therefore, it was never performed on an important number of
      individuals.  However, a better understanding of 3D knee kinematics during such activities
      would allow a better understanding of this often injured joint.

      Hypothesis: A new system using personalized 3D bone imaging and a percutaneous bone fixation
      device that can be used under local anesthesiaallows for precise and reproducible assessment
      of 3D knee kinematics during physical and daily life activities.

      Objectives :

        -  To study human knee 3D kinematics during dynamic activities using a novel minimally
           invasive measuring system

        -  Investigate the correlations between standard clinical knee laxity tests and measured
           3D knee kinematics during dynamic activities

clinical_study.brief_title: 3D Kinematic Assessment of the Human Knee During Physical and Daily Life Activities

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients awaiting knee arthroscopy under local anesthesia for a medial meniscal tear

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Active infection

          -  Severe swelling of the knee

          -  Knee flexion contracture

          -  Knee flexion less than 120 degrees

          -  Gross limping

          -  Inability to perform the various motor tasks required by the study protocol

intervention.description: 3D knee kinematic assessment under local anesthesia
intervention.intervention_name: 3D knee kinematic assessment under local anesthesia

clinical_study.official_title: (Étude de la cinématique Tridimensionnelle du Genou Humain Lors de Gestes Sportifs et de la Vie Courante)

primary_outcome.description: The investigators will investigate if 3D knee kinematics can be precisely and safely measured under local anesthesia during various motor tasks (walking, squatting, pivoting, jumping): kinematic data will be analyzed in search of signs of artefact movement and kinematic aberrations, which would indicate problems with the measurement system.
primary_outcome.time_frame: On the day of the surgery, before knee arthroscopy

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: With the kinematic measurement device attached to the bones of the lower limbs, various knee laxity tests will be performed by a physician while the kinematics of the knee are recorded; correlations will be sought between the subjective evaluation of the physician and the kinematic data.
secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of kinematic data with clinical laxity tests
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On the day of surgery, before knee arthroscopy

clinical_study.source: Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal (CHUM)

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal (CHUM)

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
